Material used.Description: Western blot analysis was performed on patient-derived fibroblasts with the TERC c.479T>C mutation.

Readout description.Result Description: Protein expression of TERC was reduced by 60% in fibroblasts with the c.479T>C mutation compared to wild-type controls.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type TERC cDNA was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector transfection was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Unpaired t-test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: TERC protein expression ≥ 85% of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: TERC protein expression < 60% of wild-type levels.

Material used.Description: Flow cytometry was conducted on HEK293 cells overexpressing the TERC c.479T>C variant.

Readout description.Result Description: Cells with the TERC c.479T>C mutation showed a 40% reduction in telomere length compared to wild-type controls.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in duplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type TERC-expressing cells were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Cells transfected with an empty vector were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Mann-Whitney U test was used for statistical analysis.
